easy to reach or use.', 'Within reach - Something that can be obtained without much effort, literally or figuratively close by.', 'Promptly available - Assures quick availability upon request.', "Quick-fetching - A colloquial expression denoting rapid provision of what's needed.", 'Straightforward to obtain - No complications in acquiring or accessing it.', 'Directly obtainable - One can attain it without detours or complexity.', 'Instantaneously accessible - Can be reached instantly, as if by pressing a button.', 'Prepared in advance - Suggests something is ready and waiting for use at any time.', 'On standby - Ready to be used whenever necessary without delay or preparation required.', 'Unfed – Literally not having been fed, leading to hunger.', 'Starving – Extreme hunger, often associated with a lack of food access.', 'Malnourished - Lacking proper nutrition which causes hunger and health issues.', 'Fasting (when unintended) - Not eating by choice or necessity can lead to the sensation of being left hungry.', 'Goiter – A thyroid condition that may result in increased appetite or feelings akin to hunger due to hormonal imbalances.']
